intro: Cynanchum boerhaviifolium, commonly known as the Boerhavia-leaved milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to the central and eastern United States. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae, which is characterized by its milky sap and often showy flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and woodlands, and it has slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a distinctive waxy coating, while its flowers are small and clustered in umbels. The plant is known for its medicinal properties, with various parts used traditionally in herbal remedies.
